In today's #teaforteaching podcast, @karenraycosta returns to discuss the ongoing impact of trauma. She suggests that perceptions of student disengagement are instead the result of this trauma and argues for expanded use of trauma-aware pedagogy. @cyberthread https://t.co/N3KSNy4D4W

@john_kane_osw @cyberthread Thank you for hosting me for a great conversation!

In today's #teaforteaching podcast, @kcroyle joins us to discuss why teaching faculty might consider moving to administrative roles as a way of leveraging their impact on students and avoiding burnout. @cyberthread https://t.co/OMeSpFJv78
@karenraycosta @john_kane_osw @cyberthread @insidehighered You mean interrogating our power and positionality and the things we actually do?

@john_kane_osw @cyberthread @insidehighered My problem with so many of these articles about student disengagement is that we are asking faculty to "put some pedagogy on it" while students run from the burning buildings. We need to start thinking in terms of systems and power.

@john_kane_osw @cyberthread @insidehighered So listen, it's a paradox. #HigherEd is not good with those.

We cannot fix this with pedagogy. 

AND

Our classrooms can be places where we work and learn together to build a better world.
@john_kane_osw @cyberthread @insidehighered faculty and staff teaching and working conditions are student learning conditions!!!!

@john_kane_osw @cyberthread @insidehighered I read a new report every day on the extent of the mental health crisis we are facing. Yesterday's was that 2021 showed record numbers of overdose deaths. 

That only 4% of provosts strongly agree that they have a formal plan in place is a dereliction of duty honestly.

@karenraycosta @john_kane_osw @cyberthread Some of the framing is wild "how can individual members of staff solve structurally society issues?" - Gee I don't know why our low-economic students in a cost of living crisis are showing up less - it's a mystery. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

@john_kane_osw @cyberthread @insidehighered Students and faculty/staff are teaching in burning buildings and we are wondering why everyone is running for the exit. Stop telling people who are engaged in their very survival that they are disengaged!

@john_kane_osw @cyberthread I'm honestly so sick of seeing this term tossed around. Let's talk about, oh, I don't know, how about PROVOST DISENGAGEMENT! This is data from this week's @insidehighered provost's report. https://t.co/aElIs2ASYS

I spoke with @john_kane_osw and @cyberthread about this yesterday for an upcoming (June 8?) episode of their Tea for Teaching podcast, so stay tuned for that. But in the meantime, I'd love for us to think more critically about how we are framing student (dis)engagement.
@john_kane_osw @cyberthread Sounds a lot like the Mastery Transcript some high schools have adopted. It‚Äôs awesome!
